_comment: Created by ianb on 08/10/2013 13:51:08 using v0.9
title: How have rates of community pressure ulcers changed?
analysis_commentary: Incidence of pressure ulcers in community settings decreased from 8.8% of sampled patients in April 2012 to 6.3% of patients in April 2013. Incidence of type 2,3 or 4 pressure ulcers are higher in community settings, with an average of 6.7% of all sampled patients having an ulcer recorded in the time period, compared to 5.0% in acute.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Safety Thermometer
